result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Kane indicates matter is not resolved yet, requests some time to finish reviewing discovery and talk to defendant on how they wish to proceed.  State has no objection.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Kane Letter to Clerk of Courts
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.

9:38 AM  Defendant Justin Lee Chaudoir in court.  Attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brian T. Kane in court for Justin Lee Chaudoir.   Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:45 AM   Defendant Justin Lee Chaudoir in court.  Attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brian T. Kane appeared by video for Justin Lee Chaudoir.  Court reviews events in file.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limits for prelim.  Set for prelim.  (set this tile and 22CF48 for prelim. on same date/time)   Atty Kane to contact JA Parks to set prelm.  Bond remains in effect.
ZOOM for Atty Kane

2:30 PM  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin Lee Chaudoir in court. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Court indicates Atty Brian Kane was just appointed today, reschedules AIA.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Per Kylie at SPD, they have not found an attorney to represent defendant yet.
Subpoena Witness Data Sheet
Defendant was fingerprinted 4/23/22.
by Gregg & Joan Chaudoir

No contact direct or indirect with T.L.J., her residence or place of employment. Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.

11:30 AM  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin Lee Chaudoir appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Brianna Zawada appeared by video for Attorney Shannon Viel for Justin Lee Chaudoir.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 5/05/22 at 2:20 pm.
